thread.title: Picture shows Kelsey Grammer wearing an anti-abortion shirt
thread.title_full: Picture shows Kelsey Grammer wearing an anti-abortion shirt - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Picture shows Kelsey Grammer wearing an anti-abortion shirt
text:
A picture of "Frasier" star Kelsey Grammer wearing an anti-abortion t-shirt is causing a buzz online.
The shirt reads: "Would it bother you more if they used guns? Abort73.com."
Actor Kelsey Grammer shows his support for the sanctity of human life pic.twitter.com/k9M3Kfy4V0
â€” Liliana Rose (@LilianaRose001) October 9, 2015 His wife was spotted a week earlier wearing the same shirt in yellow as the pair walked down the street.
Abort73.com, if you couldn't have guessed by now, is an anti-abortion website. The site argues the case against abortion via abortion regret stories, abortion photos, and explaining the abortion procedure.
Take a look at other stars and their opinions on abortion in the gallery below.
Photo: Getty Images Image 1 of / 33 33 Tami Taylor, a fictional mother, principal and counselor on "Friday Night Lights," would stand up against Texas' proposed abortion legislation, according to Connie Britton, the actress who played Taylor on the popular television show.
Britton will join four other celebrities in Austin to protest the bill, in conjunction with Planned Parenthood. And, if anyone is in need of a new political fashion statement Britton and Planned Parenthood are also selling t-shirts emblazoned with the phrase "What would Tami Taylor do?" There's a link to the political website standwithtexaswomen.org on the back.
Photo: Getty Images Tami Taylor, a fictional mother, principal and counselor on "Friday... Image 2 of 33 "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit" actress Stephanie March, a native Texan, has supported Planned Parenthood in Austin before and will do so again. March's great-grandmother, Ruby Webster March, founded a women's health clinic in Abilene in 1938 that later became Planned Parenthood of West Texas, according to the Austin-American Statesman.
Photo: Getty Images "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit" actress Stephanie March, a... Image 3 of 33 Lisa Edelstein of "House" starred in a controversial MoveOn.org commercial in 2011 in which she talks about dangerous illegal abortion methods before reaching for a coat hanger in a closet.
Edelstein has now teamed up with Planned Parenthood to protest Texas' proposed abortion legislation.
Photo: Getty Images Lisa Edelstein of "House" starred in a controversial MoveOn.org... Image 4 of 33 Dixie Chicks' Natalie Maines is also at the Texas Capitol this week, attending a rally with Britton, March, Edelstein and State Sen. Wendy Davis to speak out against the Texas abortion bill.
Dixie Chicks' Natalie Maines is also at the Texas Capitol this... Image 5 of 33 Martha Plimpton, an actress and one of the founders of A is For , an organization that supports reproductive rights, has also spoken out against Texas' proposed abortion bill.
Plimpton tweeted after State Sen. Wendy Davis' successful filibuster: "@wendydavistexas is a perfect example of what we are all capable of: strength, integrity, & defiance in the face of oppression. Love. #SB5"
Martha Plimpton, an actress and one of the founders of A is For , an... Image 6 of 33 Scarlett Johannson appeared in an ad for Move On, urging voters to support Barack Obama and warning the public that Romney could have overturned Roe v. Wade if he had been elected.
Scarlett Johannson appeared in an ad for Move On, urging voters... Image 7 of 33 Justin Bieber talked about abortion in Rolling Stone in 2011. "I really don't believe in abortion...it's like killing a baby."
Photo: Billy Calzada, San Antonio Express-News Justin Bieber talked about abortion in Rolling Stone in 2011. "I... Image 8 of 33 Ellen Page spoke out on abortions in 2010: "I am a feminist and I am totally pro-choice, but what's funny is when you say that people assume that you are pro-abortion. I don't love abortion but I want women to be able to choose, and I don't want white dudes in an office to be able to make laws on things like this. I mean what are we going to go - go back to clothes hangers?"
Photo: Todd Williamson, INVL Ellen Page spoke out on abortions in 2010: "I am a feminist and I... Image 9 of 33 Kerry Washington also appeared in the Move On ad that criticized Romney.
Kerry Washington also appeared in the Move On ad that criticized... Image 10 of 33 TV actress Patricia Heaton has used her fame to speak out about abortion. "The early feminists found abortion to be the ultimate exploitation of women," she was Quote: d as saying in The Washington Times .
Photo: David Livingston, . TV actress Patricia Heaton has used her fame to speak out about... Image 11 of 33 Eva Longoria was the third actress to appear in the Move On ad. You can watch it here .
Photo: Michael Kovac, Getty Images Eva Longoria was the third actress to appear in the Move On ad. You... Image 12 of 33 Last year, Hugh Hefner voiced his support for broad reproductive rights in a Playboy editorial calling for gay marriage rights.
Photo: Kristian Dowling, AP Last year, Hugh Hefner voiced his support for broad reproductive... Image 13 of 33 Mel Gibson is widely known to be anti-abortion. He told Barbara Walters in 1990, "God is the only one who knows how many children we should have, and we should be ready to accept them. One can't decide for oneself who comes into this world and who doesn't."
Photo: Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Mel Gibson is widely known to be anti-abortion. He told Barbara... Image 14 of 33 In 1992, Spin Magazine published an article by Pearl Jam lead singer Eddie Vedder, in which he explains why he supports women's right to choose abortion.
Photo: LeeRoy Holmes, For The Chronicle In 1992, Spin Magazine published an article by Pearl Jam lead... Image 15 of 33 Sarah Silverman sparked outrage last April when she made a bad Twitter joke about abortion. She later apologized for faking a "quickie abortion" online, but later tweeted "It wasn't funny for me to talk so casually about abortion. But when they take our right to choose away it will be HILARIOUS!"
Photo: Anna Webber, . Sarah Silverman sparked outrage last April when she made a bad... Image 16 of 33 Model Kathy Ireland has said she joined the pro-life movement when she began to believe that human life begins at the moment of conception. "Than unborn baby looks exactly the way human beings are supposed to look at that stage of development," she told Fox News . "It doesn't suddenly become a human being at a certain point in time."
Model Kathy Ireland has said she joined the pro-life movement when... Image 17 of 33 Whoopi Goldberg has attended pro-choice rallies in the past and had this to say as the hosts of "The View" discussed the new abortion documentary by Justin Bieber's mom: "Just because a woman chooses to have an abortion doesn't necessarily mean that she isn't pro-life. Each of these decisions are rarely easy to make. Women who go through this are not having a party. They mourn that life."
Photo: Mark Wilson, Getty Whoopi Goldberg has attended pro-choice rallies in the past and had... Image 18 of 33 Comedienne Chelsea Handler got lots of Twitter backlash in November when she talked about her abortion with Conan O'Brien, telling the late night host she has no regrets. She said the same thing on "The Rosie Show" last February.
Photo: Brandon Hickman Comedienne Chelsea Handler got lots of Twitter backlash in November... Image 19 of 33 Michelle Duggar and her husband, Jim Bob, are members of Quiverfull and have used their fame to advocate for the pro-life movement. "It's part of who we are," she said this week on ArkansasBusiness.com .
Photo: Scott Enlow, AP Michelle Duggar and her husband, Jim Bob, are members of Quiverfull... Image 20 of 33 Actress Amy Poehler has supported Planned Parenthood and poked fun at anti-abortion legislation along with Seth Meyers on Saturday Night Live.
Photo: Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Actress Amy Poehler has supported Planned Parenthood and poked fun ... Image 21 of 33 Lily Allen joined the abortion debate last fall, posting a series of tweets on the topic - "Can small minded idiot blokes stop telling women whether or not they're entitled to abortions please? #enoughnow."
Photo: RICHARD DREW, AP Lily Allen joined the abortion debate last fall, posting a series... Image 22 of 33 Kirk Cameron spoke about abortion to Piers Morgan last March. "I think that it's wrong, under any circumstances," Cameron said. "I think that someone who is ultimately willing to murder a child, even to fix another tragic and devastating situation - like rape or incest or things like that - is not taking the moral highroad."
Photo: Lynn Freeny Kirk Cameron spoke about abortion to Piers Morgan last March. "I... Image 23 of 33 In 2001, Julianne Moore was Quote: d in a WENN report as criticizing President George W. Bush's stance on abortion. She said, "I think that young women are not aware about this. I think that they have never been alive when abortion wasn't safe and legal, and they don't realize that it's something that can easily be taken away." Moore also appeared in an ad supporting Planned Parenthood and targeting female votes for President Obama last year.
Photo: Mark Davis, Getty Images In 2001, Julianne Moore was Quote: d in a WENN report as criticizing... Image 24 of 33 Ben Stein is strongly against abortion. "It has been medically demonstrated that babies show signs of life and personality in the womb," he said at Boston College in 2000. "Babies get extreme pain when they are murdered in the womb and to murder them strikes me as extremely outrageous."
Ben Stein is strongly against abortion. "It has been medically... Image 25 of 33 Andrea Bocelli went public with his story about how his mother rejected doctors' advice to abort him, in hopes that it will inspire other women to keep their babies. "I can tell you it was the right choice," he said.
Photo: Sergio Dionisio, Getty Images Andrea Bocelli went public with his story about how his mother... Image 26 of 33 Mary J. Blige also appeared in last year's "Yes We Plan" ad for Planned Parenthood with Julianne Moore.
Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Mary J. Blige also appeared in last year's "Yes We Plan" ad for... Image 27 of 33 Martin Sheen has said that he is personally against abortion. "I don't think abortion is a good idea," he said in this interview . "I personally am opposed to abortion, but I will not judge anybody else's right in that regard because I am not a woman and I could never face the actual reality of it."
Photo: Jason Merritt, Getty Images Martin Sheen has said that he is personally against abortion. "I... Image 28 of 33 Tina Fey spoke last fall about women's reproductive rights and definitions of rape at a gala supporting the Center for Reproductive Rights. "No woman should pay with her life for a lack of options," Fey said. "But every year, 47,000 women die from unsafe abortions."
Photo: Jordan Strauss, INVL Tina Fey spoke last fall about women's reproductive rights and... Image 29 of 33 Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick were also among the stars who voiced their support for a Bill of Reproductive Rights, which outlines a right to reproductive healthcare, including birth control, abortion and pregnancy care.
Photo: David Livingston, Getty Images Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick were also among the stars who voiced... Image 30 of 33 Jack Nicholson had the following to say about abortion: "I'm very contra my constituency in terms of abortion because I'm positively against it. I don't have the right to any other view. My only emotion is gratitude, literally, for my life."
Photo: VALERIE MACON, AFP/Getty Images Jack Nicholson had the following to say about abortion: "I'm very... Image 31 of 33 Tea Leoni also appeared in a video touting the proposed Bill of Reproductive Rights.
Photo: Stephen Lovekin, Getty Images For Worldwide Docum Tea Leoni also appeared in a video touting the proposed Bill of... Image 32 of 33 Jane Fonda has spoken out about abortion rights before. She was Quote: d in a 2000 edition of the Tucson Citizen as saying "For people who oppose abortion, life begins with conception and ends at birth."
Photo: JOE KLAMAR, AFP/Getty Images Jane Fonda has spoken out about abortion rights before. She was... Image 33 of 33 Picture shows Kelsey Grammer wearing an anti-abortion shirt 1 / 33 Back to Gallery
